alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 9:50PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Utah, including the following county, Salt Lake. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 948 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding across southern Salt lake County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen from Herriman east through Draper and Cottonwood Heights. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sandy, Murray, West Jordan, Taylorsville, South Jordan, Lehi, Draper, Riverton, Cottonwood Heights, Midvale, Holladay, Herriman, Bluffdale, Little Cottonwood Creek Valley, Granite, Cottonwood West, Little Cottonwood Canyon and Big Cottonwood Canyon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
